timeline.bodyText: Why should we remove this exception?
timeline.author: spacether

replies.bodyText:
This is to address  @jimschubert comments:

This would be a breaking change, as we failed silently for any unsupported schemes previously.
replies.author: sebastien-rosset

replies.bodyText:
@jimschubert doesn't this clause mean that we failed loudly before, not silently?
How did we fail silently before?
replies.author: spacether

replies.bodyText:
I think @jimschubert  meant codegen ignores the scheme, rather that "fail".
Ideally, developers would be able to add their own security scheme without having to fork OpenAPITools. There would be a way to register a new security scheme.
replies.author: sebastien-rosset

replies.bodyText:
Ah, I see that from our master branch at https://github.com/OpenAPITools/openapi-generator/blob/master/modules/openapi-generator/src/main/java/org/openapitools/codegen/DefaultCodegen.java#L3641. I misunderstood and thought that master had throw new RuntimeException when it was that only the earlier commit in this branch had it.
Feel free to mark this as resolved. Thank you for the explanation.
replies.author: spacether

timeline.message: spread out each requirement to a separate line

timeline.bodyText: Can you move this to processOpts? It looks like that is where we are conditionally adding supporting files.
timeline.author: spacether

replies.author: sebastien-rosset

timeline.message: remove use of strftime('%s'), which is non portable
Fix issue uncovered in integration branch
Fix issue uncovered in integration branch
Fix issue uncovered in integration branch
Fix issue uncovered in integration branch
move http signature tests to separate file
move http signature tests to separate file
add unit tests for http signature
Add separate OAS file with support for HTTP signature
Add support for private key passphrase. Add more unit tests
Add unit test to validate the signature against the public key
Refact unit test with better variable names
do not throw exception if security scheme is unrecognized
change URL of apache license to use https
fix usage of escape character in python regex. Fix generated python documentation
write HTTP signed headers in user-specified order. Fix PEP8 formatting issues
write HTTP signed headers in user-specified order. Fix PEP8 formatting issues
add api key parameters for http message signature
add api key parameters for http message signature
move python-experimental-openapiv3-sample to a separate PR
Make PKCS1v15 string constant consistent between Python and Golang
Add code comments in generated Python. Start adding unit tests for HTTP signature
Starting to move code to dedicated file for HTTP signatures
Continue to refactor code to dedicated file for HTTP signatures
Continue to refactor code to dedicated file for HTTP signatures
Continue to refactor code to dedicated file for HTTP signatures

timeline.author: spacether

replies.bodyText:
For the record I don't know when we should use supportingFiles.add vs apiTemplateFiles.put
It looks like supportingFiles.add is used more for conditional file additions, so maybe we should

use supportingFiles.add(..
move the above if statement into which uses supportingFiles.add(.. into the processOpts method
What do you think?
replies.author: spacether

replies.bodyText: yes, that's what I'm trying to do. For some reason the compiler cannot find the config symbol. I'll keep looking.
replies.author: sebastien-rosset

replies.bodyText:
Ah config is where you are. Just delete it. It should be fromSecurity(securitySchemeMap)
I just updated my suggested code sample
replies.author: spacether

replies.bodyText:
oh I just realized there are two distinct classes, DefaultGenerator and DefaultCodeGen...
PythonClientExperimentalCodegen extends from DefaultCodeGen, not DefaultGenerator, and config is defined in DefaultGenerator.
Now I can make it work, though hasHttpSignatureMethods() is not accessible from PythonClientExperimentalCodegen, but there is an easy workaround.
replies.author: sebastien-rosset

replies.bodyText:
It looks like putting
hasHttpSignatureMethods
in modules/openapi-generator/src/main/java/org/openapitools/codegen/utils/ProcessUtils.java
would work because both classes can use it.
replies.author: spacether

replies.bodyText: I have a basic question. When the constructor is invoked, has the OAS spec been parsed? Isn't it done later? Because I'm seeing a NPE and wonder if this is because the OAS spec hasn't been parsed yet, hence codegen wouldn't know what the security schemes are in the constructor.
replies.author: sebastien-rosset

replies.bodyText:
The spec is parsed, I am seeing the above code successfully generate authMethods:
authMethods = {ArrayList@2705}  size = 5
 0 = {CodegenSecurity@2714} "CodegenSecurity{name='api_key', type='apiKey', scheme='null', hasMore=true, isBasic=false, isOAuth=false, isApiKey=true, isBasicBasic=false, isBasicBearer=false, bearerFormat='null', vendorExtensions={}, keyParamName='api_key', isKeyInQuery=false, isKeyInHeader=true, isKeyInCookie=false, flow='null', authorizationUrl='null', tokenUrl='null', scopes=null, isCode=false, isPassword=false, isApplication=false, isImplicit=false}"
 1 = {CodegenSecurity@2715} "CodegenSecurity{name='api_key_query', type='apiKey', scheme='null', hasMore=true, isBasic=false, isOAuth=false, isApiKey=true, isBasicBasic=false, isBasicBearer=false, bearerFormat='null', vendorExtensions={}, keyParamName='api_key_query', isKeyInQuery=true, isKeyInHeader=false, isKeyInCookie=false, flow='null', authorizationUrl='null', tokenUrl='null', scopes=null, isCode=false, isPassword=false, isApplication=false, isImplicit=false}"
 2 = {CodegenSecurity@2716} "CodegenSecurity{name='bearer_test', type='http', scheme='bearer', hasMore=true, isBasic=true, isOAuth=false, isApiKey=false, isBasicBasic=false, isBasicBearer=true, bearerFormat='JWT', vendorExtensions={}, keyParamName='null', isKeyInQuery=false, isKeyInHeader=false, isKeyInCookie=false, flow='null', authorizationUrl='null', tokenUrl='null', scopes=null, isCode=false, isPassword=false, isApplication=false, isImplicit=false}"
 3 = {CodegenSecurity@2717} "CodegenSecurity{name='http_basic_test', type='http', scheme='basic', hasMore=true, isBasic=true, isOAuth=false, isApiKey=false, isBasicBasic=true, isBasicBearer=false, bearerFormat='null', vendorExtensions={}, keyParamName='null', isKeyInQuery=false, isKeyInHeader=false, isKeyInCookie=false, flow='null', authorizationUrl='null', tokenUrl='null', scopes=null, isCode=false, isPassword=false, isApplication=false, isImplicit=false}"
 4 = {CodegenSecurity@2718} "CodegenSecurity{name='petstore_auth', type='oauth2', scheme='null', hasMore=false, isBasic=false, isOAuth=true, isApiKey=false, isBasicBasic=false, isBasicBearer=false, bearerFormat='null', vendorExtensions={}, keyParamName='null', isKeyInQuery=false, isKeyInHeader=false, isKeyInCookie=false, flow='implicit', authorizationUrl='http://petstore.swagger.io/api/oauth/dialog', tokenUrl='null', scopes=[{scope=write:pets, hasMore=true, description=modify pets in your account}, {scope=read:pets, hasMore=null, description=read your pets}], isCode=false, isPassword=false, isApplication=false, isImplicit=true}"

Are you invoking it inside processOpts?

timeline.bodyText:
How about making this public boolean and move this into DefaultCodegen?
Then you can invoke it with config.hasHttpSignatureMethods(blah..)
timeline.author: spacether

replies.bodyText:
Or how about putting it here?
modules/openapi-generator/src/main/java/org/openapitools/codegen/utils/ProcessUtils.java
That way both classes can use it.
